com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core
Interface ConfigurationContract

All Superinterfaces:
Agreement, DeployModelObject
All Known Subinterfaces:
ExplicitContract
public interface ConfigurationContract
extends DeployModelObject, Agreement

A contract exports units, capabilities, and requirements or some combination of specific features as either private, public, or public-editable.

The contract visibility determines whether a DeployModelObject may be (1) the source or target of a link, or (2) modified by an importing Topology. Contracts work with Imports to establish encapsulated, reusable, configurable Topologies to share amongst different interested parties.

There are a few basic permissions:

  • A. Change the value of an(a) attribute(s)
  • B. Declare the model element as the source of a link
  • C. Declare the model element as the target of a link
  • D. Add a Capability to the Unit
  • E. Add a Requirement to the Unit

Type Visibility Permissions
Unit
private { }
public {B, C, E}
public-editable {A, B, C, D, E}
Capability or Requirement
private { }
public {B, C}
public-editable {A, B, C}

In addition, the following rules apply:

  1. Individual features may be exported,
  2. Contained elements inherit the contract visibility of their container, and
  3. The most specific contract visibility rule applies.

For example, if a Unit is private, and one of its attributes, capabilities, or requirements is exported as public or public-editable, then the Unit remains private. If the Unit is public-editable, then any attribute not explicitly marked private is also public-editable.

A representation of the content that can be exposed by this topology upon import by another topology.

See Also:
CorePackage.getConfigurationContract()

Constant Field Values
Method Detail

export

void export(DeployModelObject source,
            boolean editable)
Export the given object in the contract and indicate whether the given object should be editable when imported. When the source is editable, any feature it contains may be modified by the importing Topology, unless more specific contract rules have been applied (e.g., the feature is explicitly private).

If the source is private with this method is called with true, it will be public-editable when the method returns.

If the source is private with this method is called with false, it will be public when the method returns.

If the source is public with this method is called with true, it will be public-editable when the method returns.

If the source is public-editable with this method is called with false, it will be public-editable when the method returns.

Parameters:
source - The DeployModelObject to expose in the contract.
editable - True indicates the given source and its features may be modified by topologies that import the Topology that contains the source.

export

void export(DeployModelObject source,
            java.lang.String propertyName)
Export the given feature of the source in the contract. When the feature is editable, it may be modified by the importing Topology. The source will retain its initial contract visibility; if the source is private when this method is called, it will be private when this method returns, but it will be returned from Agreement.getPublicUnits() as it has a public-editable feature.

Parameters:
source - The DeployModelObject to expose in the contract.
propertyName - The feature of a specific property to export.

exportProperty

Property exportProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
Declare a property with the given name in the contract. Clients may refer to the variable using "$propertyname" in their attribute values.

Parameters:
propertyName - The designation of the property.
Returns:
The property that was created or found with the given name.
See Also:
Agreement.getProperty(String)

unexport

void unexport(DeployModelObject source)
Remove the export of the given object in the contract. Any more specific contract rules will remain. If a specific attribute of the source is marked as public-editable, it will remain so after this method returns.

Depending on the implementation of the contract, this may or may not formally remove all metadata associated with the source. See clear(DeployModelObject) to ensure all metadata is removed.

Parameters:
source - The DeployModelObject to remove from the contract.

unexport

void unexport(DeployModelObject source,
              EStructuralFeature feature)
Remove the export of the given feature of the source object from the contract. If source has other contract visibility rules, those will remain in tact.

Parameters:
source - The DeployModelObject of the property to remove from the contract.
feature - The feature of a specific property to export. (e.g. CorePackage.getCommunicationCapability_ApplicationLayerProtocol()).

unexportProperty

void unexportProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
Remove the declaration of a property with the given name in the contract.

Parameters:
propertyName - The name of a global property (variable) in the Topology.

clear

void clear(DeployModelObject source)
Remove all metadata stored in the contract related to the given source. The result will resent the given source to the default behavior of the contract implementation.

Parameters:
source - The DeployModelObject to remove from the contract.

getDefaultConceptualPolicy

Visibility getDefaultConceptualPolicy()
Returns the value of the 'Default Conceptual Policy' attribute. The default value is "private". The literals are from the enumeration Visibility.

If the meaning of the 'Default Conceptual Policy' attribute isn't clear, there really should be more of a description here...

Returns:
the value of the 'Default Conceptual Policy' attribute.
See Also:
Visibility

getDefaultPolicy

Visibility getDefaultPolicy()
Returns the value of the 'Default Policy' attribute. The default value is "private". The literals are from the enumeration Visibility.

If the meaning of the 'Default Policy' attribute isn't clear, there really should be more of a description here...

Returns:
the value of the 'Default Policy' attribute.
